sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Henry, Duke of Lancaster, Le livre des seintes medicines
Henry of Lancaster, Liure des Seintes Medicines
msDesc.p: Vellum, 260 165 , 10.4 x 6.5, ff. 70 + 2, 41 lines to a page. Cent. xiv late, very clearly written. In old skin wrapper folding over.

Another copy of art. 1 is at Stonyhurst College ( Hist. MSS. Comm. 1st Report , p. 145). The author was probably the second Henry of Lancaster, who died in 1361. It should be noted that he was looked upon in early times as the Founder of the College: he is so described, for instance, in the earliest Inventory of the College plate (about 1376). See also Lamb's ed. of Masters's History, pp. 22, 23.

msItem.head: Henry, Duke of Lancaster, Le livre des seintes medicines

ab.quote: Cest liuere estoit comence et parfait en lan de grace mill. CCCLIIII et le fist un fol cheitif pechour qi len appelle ERTSACNAL ED CUD IRNEH, a qi diex sez meffaitz pardoint. Amen. Amen. Amen.
Ex hac inscriptione apparet autorem fuisse Henricum ducem Lancastriae; verba enim Ertsacnal ed cud irneh si a dextra ad sinistram legantur, sonant Henri duc de Lancastre

msItem.rubric: Tres douz sire Jesu crist ceo qe ieo par laide de vous pense cy en apres a escrire Jeo vous pri et requer Sire humblement qil vous plaise a moy doner grace de ensi cest eneure comencer et accompler qe ceo soit a la plaisance de vous et al honour de vostre tres douce mere et al loange de toutz les seins et seintes de paradis. Amen
msItem.incipit: Beau sire diex de trois choses vous sui ieo principalment tenuz a dire
msItem.ab: The whole treatise is addressed to Christ and the Virgin
msItem.explicit: Seins apostles martires confessours virges et veues Ensi soit il amen par seinte charite. Amen Amen
msItem.ab: Then the colophon as given by Nasmith above

msItem.head: Louis IX of France, Monitiones to his son Philip

head.title: Monitiones quas Ludowicus rex Francorum in castris juxta Cartaginem moribundus fecit Philippo filio suo et manu propria scripsit

msItem.incipit: A. d. mill. ccmo septuagesimo obiit apud
msItem.explicit: Ad ipsum videndum amandum et laudandum sine fine Amen, finis
